page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: THE BEAUTIFUL CULLIN HILLS DOMINATE THE VILLAGE OF CARBOST,NESTLED ROUND THE THE LONG SHORELINE OF LOCH HARPORT,MAKING THE AREA A MOST ATTRACTIVE ONE FOR TOURISM,WHICH PLAYS A LARGE PART IN THE ECONOMY ,PROVIDING MANY SEASONAL JOBS. MUCH OF THE LAND SURROUNDING THE AREA IS PEAT BOG AND MOORLAND,QUITE SUITABLE FOR BREEDING SHEEP,OF WHICH THERE ARE ABOUT 2,000 IN NUMBER COMPARED TO 200 PEOPLE! ANOTHER MAIN ATTRACTION IN THE AREA IS THE LOCAL DISTILLERY,WHICH ALSO PROVIDES EMPLOYMENT LOCALLY. THE OTHER MAIN SOURCES OF EMPLOYMENT ARE THE COAL YARD AND GARAGE,THOUGH SOME PEOPLE TRAVEL THE 16 MILES TO PORTREE,OR EVEN FURTHER AFIELD TO FIND WORK.
